bibl.title: Letter from L. O. Howard to James Carroll, August 27, 1903

div1.p: Howard sends Carroll eggs of Stegomyia and more mosquitoes. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from L. O. Howard to James Carroll, August 27, 1903
div1.p:
I am at last able to send you some eggs of Stegomyia, from
Baton Rouge, La. I also send two vials of fresh mosquitoes. The
latter I have not examined carefully. I see that some of them are
Stegomyias, and they are guaranteed by my correspondent to be fresh,
so that if you want to section them they will form good material.
More eggs will be along, and I will send them to you until you tell
me to stop.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, L. O. Howard Dr. James Carroll,
Army Medical Museum,
Washington, D.C.
hl
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
* 1934 *
[unclear]
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Washington, D. C.
RECORDS OF THE BUREAU OF ENTOMOLOGY AND PLANT QUARANTINE
